messages.content: What do you know about the F-16?

The F-16, also known as the Fighting Falcon, is a single-engine supersonic fighter aircraft originally developed by General Dynamics (now Lockheed Martin) for the United States Air Force. It is a highly maneuverable multirole fighter that can be used for air-to-air combat, air-to-surface attacks, and reconnaissance missions. It has been in service since 1978 and has been used by many countries around the world. The F-16 is equipped with a variety of weapons, including missiles, bombs, and guns. It is known for its agility, speed, and versatility.
Please list all countries that use the F-16.

The F-16 Fighting Falcon is used by the following countries:

1. United States
2. Belgium
3. Denmark
4. Egypt
5. Greece
6. Indonesia
7. Israel
8. Italy
9. Jordan
10. Morocco
11. Netherlands
12. Norway
13. Oman
14. Pakistan
15. Poland
16. Portugal
17. Singapore
18. South Korea
19. Taiwan
20. Thailand
21. Turkey
22. United Arab Emirates

Some of these countries have used older variants of the F-16, while others have upgraded to newer versions.
